sources.title: Gemini-TTS | Cloud Text-to-Speech
sources.snippet: Using Gemini-TTS, you can synthesize single or multi-speaker speech from short snippets to long-form narratives, precisely dictating style, accent, pace, tone, ...Read more

citation_mappings.claim_text: Here are some text-to-speech (TTS) services and tools that can generate conversations with multiple voices (good for dialogues, narration with different speakers, etc.): Cloud & API-based solutions Google Cloud Text-to-Speech / Gemini-TTS – supports multi-speaker synthesis and detailed control over style, tone, accent, and pace, suitable for conversation-like generation via API. Google Cloud+1
Amazon Polly (AWS) – many languages/voices and SSML support to script different speakers; good for programmatic multi-voice output. Amazon Web Services, Inc.

sources.title: ElevenLabs: Free AI Voice Generator & Voice Agents Platform
sources.snippet: Create lifelike speech with our AI voice generator and voice agents platform. Access 5000+ voices in 70+ languages with secure APIs and SDKs.

sources.title: Eleven v3 Audio Tags: Multi-Character Dialogue in AI ...
sources.snippet: Oct 16, 2025 — Create dynamic multi-character dialogue with Eleven v3 Audio Tags. Script overlapping voices, interruptions, and emotional shifts.

citation_mappings.claim_text: AI voice platforms with multi-speaker dialogue focus ElevenLabs – offers large voice library and features (including multi-character dialogue tags for overlapping and emotional exchanges). ElevenLabs+1
Kukarella – specifically advertises AI dialogue generation with multiple voices and voice cloning. Kukarella
Murf AI – 200+ voices and languages, widely used for voiceover and narrated content; can assign different voices per speaker. Murf AI
NoteVibes – lots of voices and languages, suitable for dialogue if you manually assign voices to parts of the script. NotevibesLM

sources.title: All Voice Lab: High Fidelity Voice Cloning & Text-to-Speech

sources.title: Microsoft's new AI can turn plain text into a full podcast - and it's freakishly good at it
sources.snippet:
Microsoft has launched a new open-source AI project called **VibeVoice**, a powerful text-to-speech (TTS) framework capable of generating realistic, expressive, long-form audio from plain text — including full-length podcasts. Unlike traditional TTS models, VibeVoice excels in generating up to **90 minutes of audio**, supports **up to four distinct AI-generated speakers**, and handles natural conversation flow and speaker consistency.

Two versions are currently available for testing: a **1.5 billion parameter model**, which supports longer content and a **64k context window**, and a **7 billion parameter model**, offering higher quality but with a **shorter 45-minute audio limit** and **32k context window**. A **lighter 0.5 billion parameter** version for real-time audio is coming soon. The models run on relatively moderate VRAM — from 7GB to 18GB depending on size — making local usage feasible.

VibeVoice supports both **English and Mandarin**, with potential expansion to other languages. It can generate multi-speaker dialogue and express emotions but isn’t yet skilled at singing. Future plans include **voice cloning** capabilities. VibeVoice is accessible via GitHub, Hugging Face, or an online demo, and it promises significant value not just in media but also in accessibility and personal digital assistants.

citation_mappings.claim_text: If you want open-source/experimental frameworks that support long multi-speaker conversational audio (e.g., podcasts): Microsoft VibeVoice (open-source project) can generate multi-speaker spoken dialogs or podcasts from plain text (usable locally or via models). Windows Central
